intro: Duvernoia potarensis var. tetrapora, commonly known as the tetrapora duvernoia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its distinctive morphology, featuring a woody stem and compound leaves with a unique arrangement. The plant exhibits tetraploidy, which contributes to its genetic diversity and adaptability. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a fragrant scent to attract pollinators. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
